business

Class InventoryItemImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • business.InventoryItemImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InventoryItem, Testable, java.io.Serializable

    public class InventoryItemImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements InventoryItem, Testable, java.io.Serializable
    An object of this class - InventoryItemImpl - represents one kind of item that a company keeps in stock that are ready for sale, for raw materials or partially manufactured goods. * The classes methods make it possible to:
    • obtain data from an external file
    • increase and decrease the stock
    • place sales orders
    • place and receive replenishment orders
    • monitor ship sales orders
    • produce a report of current stock condition
    Author:
    Igor Entaltsev
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • receiveReplenishment

        public java.lang.String receiveReplenishment(int qtyReceived)
        Reduces the totalOrdered by the qtyReceived then call increaseStock(qtyReceived). Returns the message “Replenishment received of [qtyReceived] for [inventoryId].” followed by the messages returned by the call to the increaseStock() method. Stores the current date and time in lastUpdated.
        Specified by:
        receiveReplenishment in interface InventoryItem
        Parameters:
        qtyReceived -
        Returns:
        outMsg

      • shipSalesOrder

        public java.lang.String shipSalesOrder(int qtyShipped)
        Reduces totalSalesOrders by the qtyShipped then calls decreaseStock(qtyShipped). Returns the message “Goods [qtyShipped] items shipped for [inventoryId].” followed by the message(s) returned by the call to the decreaseStock() method. Stores the current date and time in lastUpdated.
        Specified by:
        shipSalesOrder in interface InventoryItem
        Parameters:
        qtyShipped -
        Returns:
        outMsg:String

      • update

        public int update(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
        The StringBuffer passed as parameter 1 is in CSV format and was produced by getData() above. Creates a StringTokenizer using the first character of the StringBuffer as the separator. Extracts each token and uses the data to update the instance data items, converting the data as necessary. Stores the current date and time in lastUpdated.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Testable
        Parameters:
        sb -
        Returns:
        err:int
